citation.article-title: Lentibacillus salicampi gen. nov., sp. nov., a moderately halophilic bacterium isolated from a salt field in Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lentibacillus salicampi sp. nov.
Lentibacillus salicampi (sa.li.cam'pi. L. n. sal salt ; L. n. campus field; N.L. gen. n. salicampi of a salt field)
Exhibits the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are Gramvariable, aerobic rods, 0.4-0.7x2.0-4.0 μm, motile by single flagella.
Colonies are 1-2 mm in diameter after 7 days on MA supplemented with 3.1% NaCl.
Growth occurs at 15 and 40°C but not at 10 or above 41°C.
Optimal pH for growth is pH 6.0-8.0 and no growth is observed at pH 5.0.
Optimal NaCl concentration for growth is 4-8% (w/v).
Growth occurs in the presence of 23% NaCl, but not in the absence of NaCl or in the presence of more than 24% NaCl.
Anaerobic growth does not occur on MA supplemented with 3.1% NaCl.
Aesculin, hypoxanthine, starch, tyrosine and xanthine are not hydrolysed.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, L-arabinose, D-cellobiose, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, lactose, maltose, D-mannitol, D-mannose, D-melezitose, melibiose, myo-inositol, D-raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, D-sorbitol, sucrose, D-trehalose or D-xylose.
The G+C content of the type strain is 44 mol% (determined by HPLC).
The type strain, strain SF-20T (=KCCM 41560T=JCM 11462T), was isolated from a salt field of the Yellow Sea in Korea.
